Classes/EkoClient.html#/c:objc(cs)EkoCli.name: -registerDeviceWithUserId:displayName:
Classes/EkoClient.html#/c:objc(cs)EkoCli.abstract: Registers the the user with the current device. If the passed userId does not match the current user the current user will be unregistered

Classes/EkoClient.html#/c:objc(cs)EkoCli.name: -unregisterDevice
Classes/EkoClient.html#/c:objc(cs)EkoCli.abstract: Unregisters the current user associated with the device. The device will be unregisted for push notifications and data associated with the user will be removed from the device

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.name: -joinChannel:type:
Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.abstract: Joins a channel by channel Id, if you are already in this channel, it will fetch the existing channel

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.name: -getChannel:
Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.abstract: Gets an existing channel by channel Id

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.name: -markSeenForChannelId:readToSegment:completion:
Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.abstract: Mark this channel as seen, this marks the last message of this channel as read

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.abstract: Sets the tags for the given channel

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html#/c:obj.name: -setDisplayNameForChannel:displayName:completion:

Classes/EkoChannelParticipation.html.name: EkoChannelParticipation
Classes/EkoChannelParticipation.html.abstract: A membership encapsulates methods for managing users in a channel

Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html.name: EkoChannelRepository
Classes/EkoChannelRepository.html.abstract: Repository provides access channel and collections of channels

Classes/EkoClient.html.name: EkoClient
Classes/EkoClient.html.abstract: The Client object serves as an SDK entry point. Should be instatiated with an Application key and be retained by the caller. A valid context instance should be used to create other SDK resources

Classes/EkoCollection.html.name: EkoCollection
Classes/EkoCollection.html.abstract: A collection is a container type returned from queries. Clients can request to load more and observe insertions and changes to the objects in the collection. Initially the count will be zero. Observers will be notified of changes.

Classes/EkoMediaRepository.html.name: EkoMediaRepository
Classes/EkoMediaRepository.html.abstract: Provides access to the media associated with messages

Type Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
